title: topk cudaerror traceback...
body_html:
Recently I've been trying to use the topk function on a NN. But when I execute the following code ...

import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable


b_x = Variable(torch.rand(16*2775*300).view(1,16,2775,300).cuda())    
b_x=b_x.topk(20,2)[1]

print(b_x)
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "<ipython-input-4-bc9526cb72e9>", line 1, in <module>
    print(b_x)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/autograd/variable.py", line 117, in __repr__
    return 'Variable containing:' + self.data.__repr__()

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 133, in __repr__
    return str(self)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 140, in __str__
    return _tensor_str._str(self)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_tensor_str.py", line 290, in _str
    strt = _tensor_str(self)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_tensor_str.py", line 138, in _tensor_str
    formatter = _number_format(self, min_sz=3 if not print_full_mat else 0)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_tensor_str.py", line 70, in _number_format
    tensor = torch.DoubleTensor(tensor.size()).copy_(tensor).abs_().view(tensor.nelement())

RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (6) : the launch timed out and was terminated at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1502008109146/work/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCTensorCopy.c:65

The error says "the launch timed out and was terminated" so its not a OOM in theory...

If I execute the code with lower sizes in the b_x, it works (so to reproduce the error, probably you need to change the sizes of b_x).

But reproducing this with lower sizes of b_x but in a for loop, it also crashes with the same error cuda runtime error (6)...

for j in range(10):     
    b_x = Variable(torch.rand(16*675*300).view(1,16,675,300).cuda())    
    b_x=b_x.topk(20,2)[1]

Maybe the traceback is not well traced in the topk function ...
Maybe some variables were not freed...
body_text:
Recently I've been trying to use the topk function on a NN. But when I execute the following code ...
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable


b_x = Variable(torch.rand(16*2775*300).view(1,16,2775,300).cuda())    
b_x=b_x.topk(20,2)[1]

print(b_x)
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "<ipython-input-4-bc9526cb72e9>", line 1, in <module>
    print(b_x)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/autograd/variable.py", line 117, in __repr__
    return 'Variable containing:' + self.data.__repr__()

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 133, in __repr__
    return str(self)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 140, in __str__
    return _tensor_str._str(self)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_tensor_str.py", line 290, in _str
    strt = _tensor_str(self)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_tensor_str.py", line 138, in _tensor_str
    formatter = _number_format(self, min_sz=3 if not print_full_mat else 0)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_tensor_str.py", line 70, in _number_format
    tensor = torch.DoubleTensor(tensor.size()).copy_(tensor).abs_().view(tensor.nelement())

RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (6) : the launch timed out and was terminated at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1502008109146/work/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCTensorCopy.c:65

The error says "the launch timed out and was terminated" so its not a OOM in theory...
If I execute the code with lower sizes in the b_x, it works (so to reproduce the error, probably you need to change the sizes of b_x).
But reproducing this with lower sizes of b_x but in a for loop, it also crashes with the same error cuda runtime error (6)...
for j in range(10):     
    b_x = Variable(torch.rand(16*675*300).view(1,16,675,300).cuda())    
    b_x=b_x.topk(20,2)[1]


Maybe the traceback is not well traced in the topk function ...
Maybe some variables were not freed...
body:
Recently I've been trying to use the topk function on a NN. But when I execute the following code ...

```
import torch
from torch.autograd import Variable


b_x = Variable(torch.rand(16*2775*300).view(1,16,2775,300).cuda())    
b_x=b_x.topk(20,2)[1]

print(b_x)
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "<ipython-input-4-bc9526cb72e9>", line 1, in <module>
    print(b_x)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/autograd/variable.py", line 117, in __repr__
    return 'Variable containing:' + self.data.__repr__()

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 133, in __repr__
    return str(self)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 140, in __str__
    return _tensor_str._str(self)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_tensor_str.py", line 290, in _str
    strt = _tensor_str(self)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_tensor_str.py", line 138, in _tensor_str
    formatter = _number_format(self, min_sz=3 if not print_full_mat else 0)

  File "/home/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.5/site-packages/torch/_tensor_str.py", line 70, in _number_format
    tensor = torch.DoubleTensor(tensor.size()).copy_(tensor).abs_().view(tensor.nelement())

RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (6) : the launch timed out and was terminated at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1502008109146/work/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCTensorCopy.c:65
```

The error says "the launch timed out and was terminated" so its not a OOM in theory...

If I execute the code with lower sizes in the b_x, it works (so to reproduce the error, probably you need to change the sizes of b_x).

But reproducing this with lower sizes of b_x but in a for loop, it also crashes with the same error cuda runtime error (6)...
```
for j in range(10):     
    b_x = Variable(torch.rand(16*675*300).view(1,16,675,300).cuda())    
    b_x=b_x.topk(20,2)[1]

```
Maybe the traceback is not well traced in the topk function ...
Maybe some variables were not freed...
